intro: Silene zangdongensis, commonly known as the Zangdong catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau in China. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive pinkish-purple flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, adapting to the harsh climatic conditions of its habitat. Silene zangdongensis is a perennial herb with lance-shaped leaves and is often found in meadows and open slopes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its region.
